resources.name: Mental Health Advocacy Services (MHAS) - Project New Start
resources.description: Provides comprehensive job placement, mental health, and legal services for formerly incarcerated individuals experiencing mental health challenges. Partnership with Painted Brain combats employment barriers for system-impacted individuals in South Los Angeles.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Formerly incarcerated individuals residing in South Los Angeles who are experiencing mental health challenges. All client intakes conducted by telephone.
resources.fees: Free legal and mental health services
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Mental Health Advocacy Services Project New Start Los Angeles'

resources.name: Friends Outside in Los Angeles County (FOLA)
resources.description: Provides services to families, children, and their incarcerated and formerly incarcerated family members, addressing the immediate and long-term consequences of incarceration through specialized employment, case management, and family support services.
services_offered: Services for incarcerated parents and families
resources.eligibility_requirements: Families and children with incarcerated or formerly incarcerated family members. Services address needs throughout Los Angeles County.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Friends Outside Los Angeles County FOLA reentry'

resources.name: LA:RISE (Los Angeles Regional Initiative for Social Enterprise)
resources.description: Innovative transitional job training program uniting City and County workforce agencies with employment social enterprises to provide 3-12 month paid employment, training, and support for individuals overcoming barriers to employment.
resources.address: Multiple partner locations throughout LA County
resources.eligibility_requirements: Angelenos striving for a better future who are overcoming barriers to employment, including formerly incarcerated individuals, those experiencing homelessness, and others with high barriers to employment.
resources.fees: Free - participants are paid for their work
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'LA:RISE Los Angeles employment reentry'

resources.name: Five Keys Charter School - Southern California
resources.description: Accredited charter school providing education, workforce development, career technical education, and reentry programs at over 80 locations including community sites, county jails, and prisons across California.
services_offered: High school diploma and GED programs
Reentry programs for youth and adults
resources.eligibility_requirements: Transitional-aged youth and adults involved in criminal justice system. Programs available in custody and in community settings.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Five Keys Los Angeles reentry education'

resources.name: Exodus Recovery - Downtown Los Angeles (Marengo)
resources.description: Provides comprehensive psychiatric and substance use disorder treatment services including outpatient programs, counseling, mental health services, and reentry support. Serving Southern California communities since 1989.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals with substance use disorders and/or mental health needs. Can access via LA County Substance Abuse Service Helpline (SASH) at 1-844-804-7500.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Exodus Recovery Los Angeles substance abuse'

resources.name: Project 180 - Downtown Headquarters
resources.description: Comprehensive diversion and reentry programs offering forensic treatment services for Angelenos involved in the criminal justice system. Addresses behavioral health needs along with practical reentry support including housing, employment, and family reunification.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Angelenos involved in the criminal justice system with behavioral health needs. Serves individuals in diversion programs and those reentering the community.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Project 180 Los Angeles mental health diversion'

resources.name: Amity Foundation - Amistad de Los Angeles
resources.description: Residential reentry program providing comprehensive reintegration services for men transitioning from incarceration. Offers addiction treatment, housing, life skills development, and community reintegration support for up to 184 residents.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Men exiting the justice system who need residential reentry support. Serves individuals with substance use histories and those needing structured reintegration assistance. Licensed by California Department of Health Care Services.
resources.fees: Program fees based on eligibility and funding
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Amity Foundation Los Angeles reentry'

resources.name: Prototypes Women's Center - Pomona (HealthRIGHT 360)
resources.description: Residential and outpatient substance abuse treatment center specifically for women, rebuilding lives impacted by substance use, mental illness, and domestic violence. Serves Second Chance Women's Reentry Court participants.
services_offered: Second Chance Women's Reentry Court services
resources.eligibility_requirements: Women impacted by substance use, mental illness, and/or domestic violence. Priority for those involved in criminal justice system including Reentry Court participants.
resources.fees: Accepts Medi-Cal and other insurance, sliding scale available
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Prototypes Los Angeles women substance abuse reentry'

resources.name: Behavioral Health Services, Inc. (BHS)
resources.description: Nonprofit integrated healthcare organization providing behavioral health and addiction treatment services since 1973 from 21 sites throughout Los Angeles County. Serves formerly incarcerated individuals with comprehensive treatment and support.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals with substance use disorders and/or mental health needs, including formerly incarcerated individuals. Services available through LA County Substance Abuse Service Helpline.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Behavioral Health Services Los Angeles reentry'

resources.name: Tarzana Treatment Centers - Main Facility
resources.description: Since 1972, provides high-quality, affordable behavioral healthcare and addiction treatment including medical detoxification, residential and outpatient SUD treatment, mental health services, and transitional housing for HIV-positive parolees.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals with substance use disorders and/or mental health needs. Transitional housing program specifically serves HIV-positive parolees in LA County.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Tarzana Treatment Centers Los Angeles reentry'

resources.name: Kedren Community Health Center
resources.description: Providing compassionate primary and mental health care services to South Los Angeles community for over 60 years. Offers integrated health and behavioral health services for children, youth, adults, and families.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Residents of South Los Angeles and Los Angeles County. Serves all ages including children, youth, adults, and families.
resources.fees: Accepts Medi-Cal and other insurance, sliding scale available
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Kedren Community Health Center Los Angeles mental health'

resources.name: Volunteers of America Los Angeles (VOALA)
resources.description: Provides comprehensive services including Office of Diversion and Reentry programs connecting chronically homeless, dual-diagnosed, frequently incarcerated individuals with permanent housing solutions and supportive services.
services_offered: Office of Diversion and Reentry programs
resources.eligibility_requirements: Chronically homeless individuals, those with dual diagnoses (mental health and substance use), and frequently incarcerated individuals. Also serves veterans and their families.
resources.fees: Services based on program eligibility and funding
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Volunteers of America Los Angeles reentry'

notes: Second research batch for Los Angeles, CA expansion. Focus on mental health, substance abuse treatment, women's services, and specialized reentry programs. All contact information verified from organization websites and official sources.
